column4: if anyone recognizes me from last night, I was the one who had GRUB MBR corruption issues. That has been fixed, and I booted into Ubuntu fine
my update manager doesn't do anything even when I provide it with the sudo root password
what do you mean? I'm running Ubuntu 5.10 Breezy Badger
what are you trying to run? Do you have more than one users on system? Are you logged in as first user created in installation?
I am running as the user it created as "michael"
is it the first user created in installation? Which app are you trying to run?
when the setup asked me to create a user, I created a user named michael
Ok. And what application are you trying to run?
I am trying to run the update manager
it asks me for the password, I type it in, then click "ok"... then nothing happens
AFAIK, update manager won't comeup if there are no updates. Try running synaptic instead
I don't think so. But that apt-get thing changed the update manager's icon from "37 updates" to "update manager is working"
this is weird, you can run apt-get but not update manager
